721756f-a.text:
Mott Street, north from, but not including Park Street (now Mosco Street) to, but not including Bayard Street.
About 1890.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
721756f-a.folder: Mott Street & Park Street, Manhattan, NY

721745f.text:
Mott Street, north side, east from a point in line of Park Street, to the Chatham Square (right), showing a portion of New York's Chinatown. At the left is the distinctive structure housing the Chinese Empire Reform Association and a Joss House. This is No. 20 Mott St. It also provided entrance to the enclosed passageway to Doyers Street, emerging at the "Bloody Angle". View 2 is a photostatic reproduction of the original.
About 1900
No's. 1-2
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
721745f.folder: Mott Street & Park Street, Manhattan, NY

724828f-a.title: Manhattan: Worth Street - Park Row
724828f-a.text:
Worth Street, Park Row to Mulberry Street.
(Before Reconstruction)

President Borough of Manhattan
January 29, 1919.

721744f-a.title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Chatham Square
721744f-a.text:
Mott Street, at the N.E. corner of Chatham Square, as seen from Worth Street.
October 8, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NEG. # 1158

721757f-a.text:
39-45 Mott Street, west side, between Park (now Mosco) and Bayard Streets. (Pell Street, is shown on the east side of the Street, and terminating there.)
October 8, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

718665f-a.title: Manhattan: Chatham Square - [Mott Street.]
718665f-a.text:
5 Chatham Square, west side, north of Mott Street, showing the entrance to a motion picture theatre.
1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.

722466f.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Chatham Square
722466f.text:
Park Row, south from Chatham Square, showing the street level overshadowed by the City Hall division of the 2nd and 3rd Avenue "E1" line. ' In the background are the Municipal and Federal Court House buildings. The photographer's vantage point is the platform
of the South Ferry division on New Bowery.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of 1. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
722466f.folder: Park Row & Chatham Square, Manhattan, NY
